warning-info.text: Flood Warning for Tully and Murray Rivers
by the Bureau of Meteorology, Brisbane.
The next warning is due to be issued by 9:30 am AEST on Sunday 20th March 2016.

text.p: Issue Number: 4
Minor flood levels are easing on the Murray River at Murray Flats.
Daily rainfall totals recorded to 9:00 am Saturday of between 50-135 mm across the lower Tully River catchment, and 30-80 mm of rainfall over the Murray River catchment.
No further significant rainfall is forecast.
TULLY RIVER:
River levels at Euramo eased below minor late Friday afternoon.
MURRAY RIVER:
A minor flood peak to 7.30 metres was recorded at Murray Flats at about 11pm Friday night. Minor flood levels continue to slowly ease during Saturday morning.
TULLY RIVER at:
EURAMO: Remain below the minor flood level (6.0 metres).
MURRAY RIVER at:
MURRAY FLATS: Ease below the minor flood level (7.0 metres) during Saturday afternoon or evening.
Remember: If it's flooded, forget it.
For flood emergency assistance contact the SES on 132 500
For life threatening emergencies, call Triple Zero (000) immediately
Current emergency information is available at www.qldalert.com

forecast-period.text: For the latest weather forecasts see: www.bom.gov.au/qld/forecasts

# auto station
Warnings and River Height Bulletins are available at www.bom.gov.au/qld/flood
Flood Warnings are also available on telephone 1300 659 219 at a low call cost of 27.5 cents, more from mobile, public and satellite phones.

hazard.text: MINOR FLOOD WARNING FOR THE MURRAY RIVER
